Methods¶

DnnLik.__init__(name=None, data=None, input_data_file=None, input_likelihood_file=None, load_on_RAM=False, seed=None, dtype=None, same_data=True, model_data_inputs=None, model_define_inputs=None, model_optimizer_inputs=None, model_compile_inputs=None, model_callbacks_inputs=None, model_train_inputs=None, resources_inputs=None, output_folder=None, ensemble_name=None, input_summary_json_file=None, verbose=True)[source]¶

The DnnLik object can be initialized in two different ways, depending on the value of the input_summary_json_file argument.

  • input_summary_json_file is None (default)

    All other arguments are parsed and saved in corresponding attributes. If no name is given, then one is created. If the input argument ensemble_name is not None the object is assumed to be part of a DnnLikEnsemble object and the corresponding attribute DnnLik.ensemble_folder is set to the partent directory of output_folder. The full object is saved through the DnnLik.save method.

  • input_summary_json_file is not None

    The object is reconstructed from the input files. First the log and summary_json files are loaded through the private method DnnLik.__load_summary_json_and_log, then, if the input arguments dtype and/or seed are provided, the corresponding attributes are set to their values (overwriting the values imported from files), and finally all other attributes are loaded through the private methods:

    • DnnLik.__load_data_indices

    • DnnLik.__load_history_and_log

    • DnnLik.__load_model

    • DnnLik.__load_predictions

    • DnnLik.__load_scalers_and_log

    Moreover, depending on the value of the input argument output_folder the DnnLik.__init__ method behaves as follows:

    • If output_folder is None (default)

      The attribute DnnLik.output_folder is set from the DnnLik.input_folder one.

    • If output_folder corresponds to a path different from that stored in the loaded DnnLik.output_folder attribute

      • if path stored in the loaded DnnLik.output_folder attribute exists, then its content is copied to the new output_folder (if the new output_foler already exists it is renamed by adding a timestamp);

      • if path stored in the loaded DnnLik.output_folder does not exists, then the content of the path DnnLik.input_folder is copied to the new output_folder.

    • If output_folder corresponds to the same path stored in the loaded DnnLik.output_folder attribute

      Output folder, files, and path attributes are not updated and everything is read from the loaded object.

    Only the json summary and log files are saved (overwriting the old ones) through the methods:

    • DnnLik.save_summary_json

    • DnnLik.save_log

Resources, data, seed, dtype and TensorFlow objects are set in the same way, independently of the value of input_summary_json_file, through the private methods:

  • DnnLik.__set_data

  • DnnLik.__set_dtype

  • DnnLik.__set_resources

  • DnnLik.__set_seed

  • DnnLik.__set_tf_objects

  • Arguments

    See class Arguments documentation.

  • Produces file

    • DnnLik.output_log_file

    • DnnLik.output_summary_json_file

DnnLik._DnnLik__set_resources(verbose=None)¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__init__ one to set resources. If DnnLik.__resources_inputs <DNNLikelihood.DnnLik.__resources_inputs is None, it calls the methods DnnLik.get_available_cpu <DNNLikelihood.DnnLik.get_available_cpu() and DnnLik.set_gpus <DNNLikelihood.DnnLik.set_gpus() inherited from the Verbosity class, otherwise it sets resources from input arguments. The latter method is needed, when the object is a member of an esemble, to pass available resources from the parent DnnLikEnsemble object.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

DnnLik._DnnLik__check_define_input_files(verbose=False)¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__init__ one to set the attributes corresponding to input files:

  • DnnLik.input_files_base_name

  • DnnLik.input_history_json_file

  • DnnLik.input_idx_h5_file

  • DnnLik.input_log_file

  • DnnLik.input_predictions_h5_file

  • DnnLik.input_scalers_pickle_file

  • DnnLik.input_tf_model_h5_file

depending on the value of the DnnLik.input_summary_json_file attribute. It also sets the attribute DnnLik.input_data_file if the object has been initialized directly from a Data object.

DnnLik._DnnLik__check_define_output_files(output_folder=None, timestamp=None, verbose=False)¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__init__ one to set the attributes corresponding to output folders

  • DnnLik.output_figures_folder

  • DnnLik.output_folder

and output files

  • DnnLik.output_figures_base_file

  • DnnLik.output_files_base_name

  • DnnLik.output_history_json_file

  • DnnLik.output_idx_h5_file

  • DnnLik.output_log_file

  • DnnLik.output_predictions_h5_file

  • DnnLik.output_scalers_pickle_file

  • DnnLik.output_summary_json_file

  • DnnLik.output_tf_model_graph_pdf_file

  • DnnLik.output_tf_model_h5_file

  • DnnLik.output_tf_model_json_file

  • DnnLik.output_tf_model_onnx_file

depending on the value of the DnnLik.input_file and DnnLik.output_folder attributes. It also initializes (to None) the attributes:

  • DnnLik.output_checkpoints_files

  • DnnLik.output_checkpoints_folder

  • DnnLik.output_figure_plot_losses_keras_file

  • DnnLik.output_tensorboard_log_dir

and creates the folders DnnLik.output_folder and DnnLik.output_figures_folder if they do not exist.

DnnLik._DnnLik__check_define_name()¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__init__ one to define the DnnLik.name attribute. If it is None it replaces it with "model_"+datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d-%H-%M-%S.%fZ")[:-3]+"_DNNLikelihood".

DnnLik._DnnLik__check_npoints()¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__set_data one to check that the required number of points for train/val/test is less than the total number of available points in the DnnLik.data object.

DnnLik._DnnLik__check_define_model_data_inputs(verbose=None)¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__init__ one to check the private dictionary DnnLik.__model_data_inputs. It checks if the item "npoints" is correctly specified and if it is not it raises an exception. If valitadion and test number of points are input as fractions of the training one, then it converts them to absolute number of points. It checks if the items "scalerX", "scalerY", and "weighted" are defined and, if they are not, it sets them to their default value False.

DnnLik._DnnLik__check_define_model_define_inputs(verbose=None)¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__init__ one to check the private dictionary DnnLik.__model_define_inputs. It checks if the items "act_func_out_layer", "dropout_rate", and "batch_norm" are defined and, if they are not, it sets them to their default values "linear", 0, and False, respectively.

DnnLik._DnnLik__check_define_model_compile_inputs(verbose=None)¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__init__ one to check the private dictionary DnnLik.__model_compile_inputs. It checks if the attribure exists and, if it does not, it defines it as an empty dictionary. It checks if the items "loss" and "metrics" are defined and, if they are not, it sets them to their default values "mse" and ["mse","mae","mape","msle"], respectively.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

DnnLik._DnnLik__check_define_model_train_inputs()¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__init__ one to check the private dictionary DnnLik.__model_train_inputs. It checks if the items "epochs" and "batch_size" are defined and, if they are not, it raises an exception.

DnnLik._DnnLik__check_define_ensemble_folder(verbose=None)¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__init__ one to set the DnnLik.ensemble_folder and DnnLik.standalone attributes. If the object is a member of a DnnLikEnsemble object, i.e. of the DnnLik.ensemble_name attribute is not None, then the two attributes are set to the parent directory of DnnLik.output_folder and to False, respectively, otherwise they are set to None and False, respectively.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

DnnLik._DnnLik__set_seed()¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__init__ one to initialize the random state of numpy and TensorFlow to the value of DnnLik.seed.

DnnLik._DnnLik__set_dtype()¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__init__ one to set the dtype of the train/val/test data and of the internal tf.keras calculations. If the DnnLik.dtype attribute is None, then it is set to the default value "float64".

DnnLik._DnnLik__set_data(verbose=None)¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__init__ one to initialize the Data object saved in the DnnLik.data attribute and used to provide data to the DnnLik object. Data are set differently depending on the value of the attributes DnnLik.data and DnnLik.input_data_file, corresponding to the two input class arguments: data and input_data_file, respectively. If both are not None, then the former is ignored. If only DnnLik.data is not None, then DnnLik.input_data_file is set to the Data.input_file attribute of the Data object. If DnnLik.input_data_file is not None the DnnLik.data attribute is set by importing the Data object from file. Once the Data object has been set, the DnnLik.ndims attribute == set from the same attribute of the Data object, and the two private methods DnnLik.__check_npoints and DnnLik.__set_pars_info are called.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

DnnLik._DnnLik__set_pars_info()¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__set_data one to set parameters info. It sets the attributes:

  • DnnLik.pars_central

  • DnnLik.pars_pos_poi

  • DnnLik.pars_pos_nuis

  • DnnLik.pars_labels

  • DnnLik.pars_labels_auto

  • DnnLik.pars_bounds

by copying the corresponding attributes of the Data object DnnLik.data.

DnnLik._DnnLik__set_model_hyperparameters()¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__init__ one to set attributes corresponding to model hyperparameters from the private dictionaries

  • DnnLik.__model_data_inputs

  • DnnLik.__model_define_inputs

  • DnnLik.__model_train_inputs

The following attributes are set:

  • DnnLik.scalerX_bool

  • DnnLik.scalerY_bool

  • DnnLik.weighted

  • DnnLik.hidden_layers

  • DnnLik.act_func_out_layer

  • DnnLik.dropout_rate

  • DnnLik.batch_norm

  • DnnLik.epochs_required

  • DnnLik.batch_size

DnnLik._DnnLik__set_tf_objects(verbose=None)¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__init__ one to set attributes corresponding to tf.keras objects by calling the private methods:

  • DnnLik.__set_optimizer

  • DnnLik.__set_loss

  • DnnLik.__set_metrics

  • DnnLik.__set_callbacks

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

DnnLik._DnnLik__load_summary_json_and_log(verbose=None)¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__init__ one to import part of a previously saved DnnLik object from the files DnnLik.input_summary_json_file and DnnLik.input_log_file.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

DnnLik._DnnLik__load_history(verbose=None)¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__init__ one to set the DnnLik.history attribute from the file DnnLik.input_history_json_file. Once the attribute is set, it is used to set the DnnLik.epochs_available one, determined from the length of the "loss" item of the DnnLik.history dictionary. If the file is not found the DnnLik.history and DnnLik.epochs_available attributes are set to an empty dictionary {} and 0, respectively.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

DnnLik._DnnLik__load_model(verbose=None)¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__init__ one to set the DnnLik.model attribute, corresponding to the tf.keras.Model, from the file DnnLik.input_tf_model_h5_file. If the file is not found the attribute is set to None.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

DnnLik._DnnLik__load_scalers(verbose=None)¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__init__ one to set the DnnLik.scalerX and DnnLik.scalerY attributes from the file DnnLik.input_scalers_pickle_file. If the file is not found the attributes are set to None.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

DnnLik._DnnLik__load_data_indices(verbose=None)¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__init__ one to set the attributes:

  • DnnLik.idx_train

  • DnnLik.idx_val

  • DnnLik.idx_test

from the file DnnLik.input_idx_h5_file. Once the attributes are set, the items "idx_train", "idx_val", and "idx_test" of the Data.data_dictionary dictionary attribute of the Data object DnnLik.data is updated to match the three index attributes If the file is not found the attributes are set to None and the Data object is not touched.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

DnnLik._DnnLik__load_predictions(verbose=None)¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__init__ one to set the DnnLik.predictions attribute from the file DnnLik.input_predictions_h5_file. If the file is not found the attributes is set to an empty dictionary {}.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

DnnLik._DnnLik__set_optimizer(verbose=None)¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__set_tf_objects one to set the tf.keras.optimizers object. It sets the DnnLik.optimizer_string and DnnLik.optimizer attributes. The former is set from the DnnLik.__model_optimizer_inputs dictionary, while the latter is set by evaluating the former.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

DnnLik._DnnLik__set_loss(verbose=None)¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__set_tf_objects one to set the loss object. It sets the DnnLik.loss_string and DnnLik.loss attributes. The former is set from the DnnLik.__model_compile_inputs dictionary, while the latter is set by evaluating the former.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

DnnLik._DnnLik__set_metrics(verbose=None)¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__set_tf_objects one to set the metrics objects. It sets the DnnLik.metrics_string and DnnLik.metrics attributes. The former is set from the DnnLik.__model_compile_inputs dictionary, while the latter is set by evaluating each item in the the former.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

DnnLik._DnnLik__set_callbacks(verbose=None)¶

Private method used by the DnnLik.__set_tf_objects one to set the tf.keras.callbacks objects. It sets the DnnLik.callbacks_strings and DnnLik.callbacks attributes. The former is set from the DnnLik.__model_callbacks_inputs dictionary, while the latter is set by evaluating each item in the the former.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

DnnLik._DnnLik__set_epochs_to_run()¶

Private method that returns the number of epochs to run computed as the difference between the value of DnnLik.epochs_required and the value of DnnLik.epochs_available, i.e. the number of epochs available in DnnLik.history.

DnnLik._DnnLik__set_pars_labels(pars_labels)¶

Private method that returns the pars_labels choice based on the pars_labels input.

  • Arguments

    • pars_labels

      Could be either one of the keyword strings "original" and "generic" or a list of labels strings with the length of the parameters array. If pars_labels="original" or pars_labels="generic" the function returns the value of Sampler.pars_labels or Sampler.pars_labels_auto, respectively, while if pars_labels is a list, the function just returns the input.

      • type: list or str

      • shape of list: [ ]

      • accepted strings: "original", "generic"

DnnLik.compute_sample_weights(nbins=100, power=1, verbose=None)[source]¶

Method that computes weights of DnnLik.Y_train points given their distribution by calling the Data.compute_sample_weights method of the Data object DnnLik.data. When the DnnLik.weighted is True, the method is called with default arguments when data are generated. Manually call the method after data generation to compute weights with custom arguments.

  • Arguments

    • nbins

      Number of bins to histogram the sample data

      • type: int

      • default: 100

    • power

      Exponent of the inverse of the bin count used to assign weights.

      • type: float

      • default: 1

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Returns

    Numpy array of the same length of sample containing the required weights.

    • type: numpy.ndarray

    • shape: (len(sample),)

DnnLik.define_scalers(verbose=None)[source]¶

Method that defines StandardScalers based on the values of the DnnLik.scalerX_bool and DnnLik.scalerY_bool attributes. When the boolean attribute is True the scaler is fit to the corresponding training data, otherwise it is set equal to the identity. The method computes the scalers by calling the corresponding method Data.define_scalers method of the Data object DnnLik.data.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

DnnLik.generate_train_data(verbose=None)[source]¶

Method that generates training and validation data corresponding to the attributes

  • DnnLik.idx_train

  • DnnLik.X_train

  • DnnLik.Y_train

  • DnnLik.idx_val

  • DnnLik.X_val

  • DnnLik.Y_val

Data are generated by calling the methods Data.update_train_data or Data.generate_train_data of the Data object DnnLik.data depending on the value of DnnLik.same_data.

When the DnnLik object is not part of a DnnLikEnsemble object, that is when the DnnLik.standalone attribute is True, or when the DnnLik.same_data attribute is True, that means that all members of the ensemble will share the same data (or a subset of the same data if they have different number of points), then data are kept up-to-date in the Data.data_dictionary attribute of the Data object DnnLik.data. This means that data are not generated again if they are already available from another member and that if the number of points is increased, data are added to the existing ones and are not re-generated from scratch.

When instead the DnnLik object is part of a DnnLikEnsemble object and the DnnLik.same_data attribute is False, data are re-generated from scratch at each call of the method.

If the DnnLik.weighted attribute is True the DnnLik.compute_sample_weights is called with default arguments. In order to compute sample weights with different arguments, the user should call again the DnnLik.compute_sample_weights method after data generation.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Produces file

    • DnnLik.output_log_file

DnnLik.generate_test_data(verbose=None)[source]¶

Method that generates test data corresponding to the attributes

  • DnnLik.idx_train

  • DnnLik.X_train

  • DnnLik.Y_train

Differently from the training and validation data, the test data are always shared by different DnnLik objects within an DnnLikEnsemble object. Therefore test data are always kept up-to-date in the Data.data_dictionary attribute of the Data object DnnLik.data and are always generated by calling the Data.generate_test_data of the Data object DnnLik.data. In this way test data are never re-generated if they are (even partially) available.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Produces file

    • DnnLik.output_log_file

DnnLik.model_define(verbose=None)[source]¶

Method that defines the tf.keras.Model stored in the DnnLik.model attribute. The model is defined from the attributes

  • DnnLik.hidden_layers

  • DnnLik.batch_norm

  • DnnLik.dropout_rate

All hidden layers in the module are Dense layers. If DnnLik.batch_norm is True, then a batch normalization layer is added after the input layer and after each hidden layer. If DnnLik.dropout_rate is larger than 0, then a Dropout layer is added after each hidden layer with the given dropout rate.

The method also sets the three attributes:

  • DnnLik.model_params

  • DnnLik.model_trainable_params

  • DnnLik.model_non_trainable_params

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Produces file

    • DnnLik.output_log_file

DnnLik.model_compile(verbose=None)[source]¶

Method that compiles the tf.keras.Model stored in the DnnLik.model attribute. The model is compiled by calling the tf.keras.Model.compile method and passing it the attributes

  • DnnLik.loss

  • DnnLik.optimizer

  • DnnLik.metrics

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Produces file

    • DnnLik.output_log_file

DnnLik.model_build(gpu='auto', force=False, verbose=None)[source]¶

Method that calls the methods

  • DnnLik.model_define

  • DnnLik.model_compile

on a specific GPU by using the tf.distribute.OneDeviceStrategy class. Using this method different DNNLik members of a DNNLikEnsemble object can be compiled and run in parallel on different GPUs (when available). Notice that, in case the model has already been created and compiled, the method does not re-builds the model on a different GPU unless the force flag is set to True (default is False).

  • Arguments

    • gpu

      GPU number (e.g. 0,1,etc..) of the GPU where the model should be built. The available GPUs are listed in the DnnLik.active_gpus. If gpu="auto" the first GPU, corresponding to number 0 is automatically set.

      • type: int or str

      • default: auto (0)

    • force

      If set to True the model is re-built even if it was already available.

      • type: bool

      • default: False

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Produces file

    • DnnLik.output_log_file

DnnLik.model_train(verbose=None)[source]¶

Method that trains the tf.keras.Model stored in the DnnLik.model attribute. The model is trained by calling the tf.keras.Model.fit method and passing it the inputs

  • X_train (attribute DnnLik.X_train scaled with DnnLik.scalerX)

  • X_val (attribute DnnLik.X_val scaled with DnnLik.scalerX)

  • Y_train (attribute DnnLik.Y_train scaled with DnnLik.scalerY)

  • Y_val (attribute DnnLik.Y_val scaled with DnnLik.Y_val)

  • DnnLik.W_train (if DnnLik.weighted is True)

  • epochs_to_run (difference between DnnLik.epochs_required and DnnLik.epochs_available)

  • DnnLik.batch_size

  • DnnLik.callbacks

After training the method updates the attributes

  • DnnLik.model

  • DnnLik.history

  • DnnLik.epochs_available

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. The second value returned by the DNNLik.set_verbosity method is the verbosity mode passed to the tf.keras.Model.fit. See the documentation of tf.keras.Model.fit for the available verbosity modes. Also see the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Produces file

    • DnnLik.output_log_file

DnnLik.model_predict(X, batch_size=None, steps=None, x_boundaries=False, y_boundaries=False, save_log=True, verbose=None)[source]¶

Method that predicts in batches by calling the tf.keras.Model.predict method of DnnLik.model. To predict, the method first scales the vector X with the scaler DnnLik.scalerX, then computed the prediction, and finally returns the predicted vercor Y inversely scaled with DnnLik.scalerY and the prediction time normalized to a signle point (i.e. divided by batch_size). The method takes into account original boundaries for the likelihood function by setting the value of the prediction for all points outside boundaries to -np.inf.

  • Arguments

    • X

      Input vector X for which the predictions Y are computed

      • type: numpy.ndarray

      • shape: (npoints,ndim)

    • batch_size

      Batch size to be used for predictions. If None (default), then the value stored in the DnnLik.batch_size attribute is used.

      • type: int

      • default: None

    • steps

      Total number of batches on which the prediction is made. If None (default), predictions are computed for all X. See the documentation of tf.keras.Model.predict for more details.

      • type: int

      • default: None

    • x_boundaries

      Implements boundaries on the input vector. If an x point has a parameter that falls outside pars_bounds, the corresponding prediction is set to -np.inf. It could have the following values:

      • False: no bounds are imposed and all predictions are accepted.

      • True: the parameters bounds of the original likelihood function stored in the

        DnnLik.pars_bounds are used.

      • "original": same as True

      • "train": the parameters bounds computed from the maximum and minimum values of the training points

        stored in the DnnLik.pars_bounds_train are used.

      • type: bool or str

      • default: False

    • y_boundaries

      Implements boundaries on the output vector. If True, then if a y point is bigger(smaller) than the largest(smallest) y training point stored in the DNNLik.pred_bounds_train attribute, the corresponding prediction is set to -np.inf. If False then no constraint is imposed.

      • type: bool

      • default: "False"

    • save_log

      If True the DnnLik.log attribute is updated and the corresponding file is saved. This option is used to switch off log updated when the method is called by the method DNNLik.model_predict_scalar, which predicts one point at a time.

      • type: bool

      • default: True

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Produces file

    • DnnLik.output_log_file (only if save_log=True)

DnnLik.model_predict_scalar(x, x_boundaries=False, y_boundaries=False, verbose=None)[source]¶

Method that returns a prediction on a single input point. It calls the method DNNLik.model_predict with batch_size=1 and converts the output to a scalar.

  • Arguments

    • x

      One dimensional input vector x for which a scalar predictions y is computed

      • type: numpy.ndarray

      • shape: (ndim,)

    • x_boundaries

      Argument passed to the DNNLik.model_predict method.

      • type: str

      • default: "none"

    • y_boundaries

      Argument passed to the DNNLik.model_predict method.

      • type: bool

      • default: "False"

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

DnnLik.compute_maximum_model(pars_init=None, optimizer={}, x_boundaries=False, y_boundaries=False, timestamp=None, save=True, verbose=None)[source]¶

Method that computes the maximum of the DNNLikelihood predictor with an optimizer given by the user. The two optimizer that are supported are scipy and tf.keras. They work as follows.

  • scipy

    If the argument optimizer is "scipy", then the method uses the scipy.optimize.minimize method to minimize minus times the :meth:DNNLik.model_predict_scalar <DNNLikelihood.DNNLik.model_predict_scalar> function. Optimization is unconstrained since constraints determined by the ``x_boundaries and y_boundaries inputs are already applied on the predictor function. By default the method uses the Powell method and passes the maxiter and tolerance inputs to the analog ftol and maxiter input of the Powell method, respectively. Additional (or different) arguments can be passed to the scipy.optimize.minimize method through the input dictionary scipy_options.

  • tf.keras

    If the argument optimizer is not scipy, then tf.keras is used for the optimization. When optimizer is None the optimizer is set to SGD with learning_rate=1. On the other hand, the user can pass a custom optimizer in the same way as optimizers are passed to the :class:DNNLik <DNNLikelihood.DNNLik>` object, see the documentation of :argument:`model_optimizer_inputs`. The optimization is done for a maximum of ``maxiter iterations, 500 iterations per time. Every run_length iterations the prediction is compared with the previous one and, when the difference is smaller than tolerance the optimization is stopped. If tolerance is not reached within maxiter iterations, then the result is returned and a warning message is printed. If the optimization starts to deteriorate (worse result after the next 500 iterations), then the learning_rate of the optimizer is reduces by a factor of two.

The method saves the result of the optimization in the DNNLik.model_max dictionary, containing the X (type: numpy.ndarray) and Y (type: float) items.

  • Arguments

    • pars_init

      Starting point for the optimization. If not specified (None), then it is set to the parameters central value DNNLik.pars_central.

      • type: numpy.ndarray

      • shape: (ndim,)

      • default: None (automatically modified to DNNLik.pars_central)

    • maxiter

      Maximum number of iteration for the optimization. When using the tf.keras for optimization this is quantized in groups of 500 iterations. Even if tolerance is not reached, otpimization ends after maxiter iterations.

      • type: int

      • default: - default: None (automatically modified to 1000 times DNNLik.ndims)

    • tolerance

      Relative difference between the prediction at iteration i and prediction at iteration i+niter, where niter is one for scipy and 500 for tf.keras optimization.

      • type: float

      • default: 0.0001

    • optimizer

      It coule be either the string "scipy" for scipy optimization, or a string or a dictionary for tf.keras optimization. In the latter case it can be input in the same way as model_optimizer_inputs class argument.

      • type: str or dict

      • default: None (automatically modified to "tf.keras.optimizers.SGD(learning_rate=1))

    • scipy_options

      Arguments passed as additional "options" (dictionary) to the scipy.optimize.minimize method.

      • type: dict

      • default: {}

    • run_length

      In the case of optimization with tf.keras, it represents the number of iterations before evaluating the prediction and comparing it with the previous one to estimate the tolerance.

      • type: int

      • default: 500

    • x_boundaries

      Implements boundaries on the input vector. If an x point has a parameter that falls outside pars_bounds, the corresponding prediction is set to -np.inf for scipy optimization and to the prediction multiplied by 1.1 plus the squared modulus of the input vector for tf.keras optimization. It could have the following values:

      • False: no bounds are imposed and all predictions are accepted.

      • True: the parameters bounds of the original likelihood function stored in the

        DnnLik.pars_bounds are used.

      • "original": same as True

      • "train": the parameters bounds computed from the maximum and minimum values of the training points

        stored in the DnnLik.pars_bounds_train are used.

      • type: bool or str

      • default: False

      For scipy optimization the argument is passed directly to the DNNLik.model_predict_scalar method.

      • type: bool or str

      • default: False

    • y_boundaries

      Argument passed to the DNNLik.model_predict_scalar method.

      • type: bool

      • default: "False"

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Produces file

    • DnnLik.output_log_file

DnnLik.compute_profiled_maximum_model(pars=None, pars_val=None, pars_init=None, optimizer={}, x_boundaries=False, y_boundaries=False, timestamp=None, save=True, verbose=None)[source]¶

DnnLik.model_evaluate(X, Y, batch_size=None, steps=None, verbose=None)[source]¶

Method that evaluates the DNNLik.model model on the DNNLik.metrics by calling the tf.keras.Model.evaluate method.

  • Arguments

    • X

      Numpy array of X points for model evaluation.

      • type: numpy.ndarray

      • shape: (npoints,ndims)

    • Y

      Numpy array of corresponding Y points sfor model evaluation.

      • type: numpy.ndarray

      • default: (ndims,)

    • batch_size

      Batch size used for evaluation. If None (default), then it is set to the value of DNNLik.batch_size.

      • type: int

      • default: None (automatically modified to DNNLik.batch_size)

    • steps

      Total number of batches on which the evaluation is made. If None (default), predictions are computed for all X. See the documentation of tf.keras.Model.evaluate for more details.

      • type: int

      • default: None

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Produces file

    • DnnLik.output_log_file
